definition: to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
"hug shirt" worn by members of the Free Hugs Campaign (see 包包團|包包团[bao1 bao1 tuan2])

sentences.english: Another two works not included in Yoko Ono's exhibition also touched me. One is mended cups.
sentences.chinese: 只是抱抱，像約翰列儂和大野洋子的照片一樣。

sentences.english: You should tell your boyfriend Wang just hugged you.
sentences.chinese: 你應該給男朋友說王只是抱抱你而已。

sentences.english: At times Jane's mother lets her hold the baby.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮的母親偶爾會讓她抱抱小娃兒。

sentences.english: He is your sonisn't he beautiful?
sentences.chinese: 抱抱他，他是你的兒子難道他不漂亮嗎？

sentences.english: "Do you pick up a crying baby or do you leave it to cry?" she asks.
sentences.chinese: 你應該抱抱哭鬧的孩子還是任由其哭鬧？

sentences.english: " Still, she advises parents to urge their sons to "cuddle a doll.
sentences.chinese: 她還是建議父母們督促自己的兒子們“抱抱洋娃娃”。

sentences.english: It is so cuddly that she keeps hugging it all day long.
sentences.chinese: 它是那麼逗人喜歡，她整天摟摟抱抱。

sentences.english: My company has a pair of lovers, every day is like building floor cuddle.
sentences.chinese: 我公司有一對情侶，每天都都是這樣樓樓抱抱的。

definition: erhua variant of 寶貝|宝贝[bao3 bei4]
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
